data.title: Croydon’s got talent
data.meta_description: Arctic Monkeys had just won the 2008 Brit Award for Best British Album, and their frontman, Alex Turner, was leaning into the microphone. “We all went to the Brit School. We remember you all,” he
data.text:
Arctic Monkeys had just won the 2008 Brit Award for Best British Album, and their frontman, Alex Turner, was leaning into the microphone. “We all went to the Brit School. We remember you all,” he said, pointing to the rows of Brit School students in the audience with a knowing smile. Turner didn’t go to the Brit School — he was having a dig at the way this city technical college, founded 20 years ago, was taking over the charts.

ITV faded him down, and cut to a backstage interview with Fearne Cotton. But he had made his point. “I think he was taking the piss out of me, actually,” says Kate Nash, who was a Brit School student. She had just beaten Leona Lewis,
